div.p: Stability concepts in ecology. In this box, we describe the most commonly used stability concepts, their properties, and how to measure them (based on Grimm et al. 1992)

tr.th: Definition of the related stability property

tr.td: Staying essentially unchanged despite the presence of potentially disturbing external influences (disturbances)
Returning to the reference state (or dynamics) after a temporal external influence (disturbance) has been applied
Return time, size of domain of attraction
Persistence through time of population (or other ecological units based on populations)
Mean time to extinction, value of a lower nonzero limit of the state variable
